commit_message:
Delete SG log entries when SG is deleted

When security group is deleted, log entries configured for that SG
weren't removed and stayed in the DB as orphaned entries.
That patch fixes that by subscribe logapi service plugin to the
AFTER_DELETE security group events.

Closes-bug: #1939558
Change-Id: Ibffbbd3b529c31372715d9a064f7cb6bada8c424
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/37/804237/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib.callbacks import events from neutron_lib.callbacks import registry from neutron_lib.callbacks import resourcesfrom neutron.services.logapi.common import db_api as log_db_api registry.subscribe( self._clean_security_group_logs, resources.SECURITY_GROUP, events.AFTER_DELETE) def _clean_security_group_logs(self, resource, event, trigger, payload): context = payload.context.elevated() sg_id = payload.resource_id with db_api.CONTEXT_WRITER.using(context): sg_logs = log_db_api.get_logs_bound_sg(context, sg_id) for log in sg_logs: self.delete_log(context, log['id'])

commit_message:
Add extension fwaas_v2 based on neutron-api relation data

fwaas_v2 extension is added in l3_agent.ini by default from stein.
However with the newly introduced neutron-api configuration parameter
enable-fwaas, the extension have to added only when it is set to true
on neutron-api charm.

neutron-api charm adds enabled-fwaas as relation data in the commit
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-neutron-api/+/806676.
This patch removes special handling of fwaas_v2 as l3_extension_plugins
is already updated in relation data based on neutron-api enable-fwaas
configuration.

Remove python3-neutron-fwaas in package list from stein release. The
package is already part of dependency of neutron-l3-agent until Ussuri
release and the dependency will be removed from Victoria release in
package control files.

Synced charmhelpers to get related changes
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/640

Partial-Bug: #1934129
Change-Id: I07db7fb7c2f00eaf4c0a5bcc082c73922b87d1c0
(cherry pick from commit de22d6cbe2d9755048019674b8be1a4d11280649)

Change-Id: I1ec6323e5ca317a1b28ecf67f4758d7553762fac

Previously installed py2 # packages are added to PURGE_PACKAGES to purge. # Remove python3-neutron-fwaas from stein release as the package is # included as dependency for neutron-l3-agent. if cmp_os_source >= 'stein': packages.remove('python3-neutron-fwaas')

commit_message:
Add extension fwaas_v2 based on neutron-api relation data

fwaas_v2 extension is added in l3_agent.ini by default from stein.
However with the newly introduced neutron-api configuration parameter
enable-fwaas, the extension have to added only when it is set to true
on neutron-api charm.

neutron-api charm adds enabled-fwaas as relation data in the commit
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-neutron-api/+/806676.
This patch removes special handling of fwaas_v2 as l3_extension_plugins
is already updated in relation data based on neutron-api enable-fwaas
configuration.

Add python3-neutron-fwaas in py3 package list only for rocky release. The
package is already part of dependency of neutron-l3-agent until Ussuri
release and the dependency will be removed from Victoria release in
package control files.

Synced charmhelpers to get related changes
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/640

Closes-Bug: #1934129

(cherry picked from d3daa09bc49bcc5c66791565e1720a9a484ea149)
Change-Id: I1546f45635bfd7af76001c1df4f99d219a9d8039

Change-Id: Ic085c62c59459a88df93100213a20acc75e290c6

Add extension fwaas_v2 based on neutron-api relation data

fwaas_v2 extension is added in l3_agent.ini by default from stein.

commit_message:
Replace getargspec with getfullargspec

inspect.getargspec() is deprecated since py3

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/inspect.html#inspect.getargspec

Change-Id: Ib9294fbc0c58b39a762a86f0a4dd1344b63debe6

replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

subject: Guarantee that ovn-dbs-pcmk update_tasks are run when the cluster is up
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-09-13 16:06:26.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/ovn/ovn-dbs-pacemaker-puppet.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/9cab0d721a572d23243c83c8b6eba9e946f376dd', 'message': 'Guarantee that ovn-dbs-pcmk update_tasks are run when the cluster is up

On particular role compositions, the code joining the update_tasks might order
things differently then on a typical 3ctrl control plane and the ovn-dbs tasks
at step1 (which require the cluster to be up) will happen after the pacemaker
task at step1 which stops the cluster.

So we can observe something like the following:

2021-09-10 10:05:18.694945 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000959 | SKIPPED | Release the cluster shutdown lock | ovn-db-01
2021-09-10 10:05:18.695717 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000959 | TIMING | Release the cluster shutdown lock | ovn-db-01 | 0:00:59.366493 | 0.06s
2021-09-10 10:05:18.704368 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-00000000095a | TASK | Clear ovndb cluster pacemaker error
2021-09-10 10:05:19.368816 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-00000000095a | FATAL | Clear ovndb cluster pacemaker error | ovn-db-01 | error={"changed": true, "cmd": "pcs resource cleanup ovn-dbs-bundle", "delta": "0:00:00.399084", "end": "2021-09-10 10:05:20
.044985", "msg": "non-zero return code", "rc": 1, "start": "2021-09-10 10:05:19.645901", "stderr": "Error: Unable to forget failed operations of resource: ovn-dbs-bundle\nError connecting to the CIB manager: Transport endpoint is not connected\nError perf
orming operation: Transport endpoint is not connected", "stderr_lines": ["Error: Unable to forget failed operations of resource: ovn-dbs-bundle", "Error connecting to the CIB manager: Transport endpoint is not connected", "Error performing operation: Tran
sport endpoint is not connected"], "stdout": "", "stdout_lines": []}

We cannot call pcs resource cleanup at step1, we must call it at step0 so we're
guaranteed that the cluster is up, no matter how heat/ansible decide to order
the update_tasks.

Note: This is the short-term less-invasive fix. The mid-long term fix
should be around verifying that we can now remove those workarounds
that were implemented for OVN bugs.

Closes-Bug: #1943254
Change-Id: Idd827f72c0033978db7b9a8ea6acec2086cda961
(cherry picked from commit ff3173bdcf304dc726f5b03d813fa2194e2c63cc)
'}]
commit_message:
Guarantee that ovn-dbs-pcmk update_tasks are run when the cluster is up

On particular role compositions, the code joining the update_tasks might order
things differently then on a typical 3ctrl control plane and the ovn-dbs tasks
at step1 (which require the cluster to be up) will happen after the pacemaker
task at step1 which stops the cluster.

So we can observe something like the following:
2021-09-10 10:05:13.370339 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000954 | TASK | Change the bundle operation timeout
2021-09-10 10:05:14.136798 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000954 | CHANGED | Change the bundle operation timeout | ovn-db-01
2021-09-10 10:05:14.137982 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000954 | TIMING | Change the bundle operation timeout | ovn-db-01 | 0:00:54.808754 | 0.77s
2021-09-10 10:05:14.146853 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000956 | TASK | Acquire the cluster shutdown lock to stop pacemaker cluster
2021-09-10 10:05:14.508085 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000956 | CHANGED | Acquire the cluster shutdown lock to stop pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01
2021-09-10 10:05:14.509257 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000956 | TIMING | Acquire the cluster shutdown lock to stop pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01 | 0:00:55.180032 | 0.36s
2021-09-10 10:05:14.518668 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000957 | TASK | Stop pacemaker cluster
2021-09-10 10:05:18.559627 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000957 | CHANGED | Stop pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01

2021-09-10 10:05:18.560561 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000957 | TIMING | Stop pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01 | 0:00:59.231336 | 4.04s
2021-09-10 10:05:18.569161 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000958 | TASK | Start pacemaker cluster
2021-09-10 10:05:18.627924 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000958 | SKIPPED | Start pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01
2021-09-10 10:05:18.628678 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000958 | TIMING | Start pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01 | 0:00:59.299453 | 0.06s
2021-09-10 10:05:18.637292 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000959 | TASK | Release the cluster shutdown lock
2021-09-10 10:05:18.694945 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000959 | SKIPPED | Release the cluster shutdown lock | ovn-db-01
2021-09-10 10:05:18.695717 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000959 | TIMING | Release the cluster shutdown lock | ovn-db-01 | 0:00:59.366493 | 0.06s
2021-09-10 10:05:18.704368 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-00000000095a | TASK | Clear ovndb cluster pacemaker error
2021-09-10 10:05:19.368816 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-00000000095a | FATAL | Clear ovndb cluster pacemaker error | ovn-db-01 | error={"changed": true, "cmd": "pcs resource cleanup ovn-dbs-bundle", "delta": "0:00:00.399084", "end": "2021-09-10 10:05:20
.044985", "msg": "non-zero return code", "rc": 1, "start": "2021-09-10 10:05:19.645901", "stderr": "Error: Unable to forget failed operations of resource: ovn-dbs-bundle\nError connecting to the CIB manager: Transport endpoint is not connected\nError perf
orming operation: Transport endpoint is not connected", "stderr_lines": ["Error: Unable to forget failed operations of resource: ovn-dbs-bundle", "Error connecting to the CIB manager: Transport endpoint is not connected", "Error performing operation: Tran
sport endpoint is not connected"], "stdout": "", "stdout_lines": []}

We cannot call pcs resource cleanup at step1, we must call it at step0 so we're
guaranteed that the cluster is up, no matter how heat/ansible decide to order
the update_tasks.

Note: This is the short-term less-invasive fix. The mid-long term fix
should be around verifying that we can now remove those workarounds
that were implemented for OVN bugs.

Closes-Bug: #1943254
Change-Id: Idd827f72c0033978db7b9a8ea6acec2086cda961
(cherry picked from commit ff3173bdcf304dc726f5b03d813fa2194e2c63cc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/64/808664/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # When a schema change happens, the newer slaves don't connect # back to the older master and end up timing out. So we clean # up the error here until we get a fix for # https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1759974 - name: Clear ovndb cluster pacemaker error shell: "pcs resource cleanup ovn-dbs-bundle" when: - step|int == 0 # Then we ban the resource for this node. It has no effect on # the first two controllers, but when we reach the last one, # it avoids a cut in the control plane as master get chosen in # one of the updated Stopped ovn. They are in error, that why # we need the cleanup just before. - name: Ban ovndb resource on the current node. shell: "pcs resource ban ovn-dbs-bundle $(hostname | cut -d. -f1)" when: - step|int == 0
deleted_lines: # When a schema change happens, the newer slaves don't connect # back to the older master and end up timing out. So we clean # up the error here until we get a fix for # https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1759974 - name: Clear ovndb cluster pacemaker error shell: "pcs resource cleanup ovn-dbs-bundle" when: - step|int == 1 # Then we ban the resource for this node. It has no effect on # the first two controllers, but when we reach the last one, # it avoids a cut in the control plane as master get chosen in # one of the updated Stopped ovn. They are in error, that why # we need the cleanup just before. - name: Ban ovndb resource on the current node. shell: "pcs resource ban ovn-dbs-bundle $(hostname | cut -d. -f1)" when: - step|int == 1

commit_message:
Add enable-fwaas to relation data

Add enable-fwaas to neutron-plugin-api relation data so
that neutron-openvswitch updates neutron-l3-agent
configuration accordingly.

Synced charmhelpers to get related changes
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/640

Partial-Bug: #1934129

(cherry picked from commit 69af89a6158679e87d9b6c2a437268b725fbcd80)
Change-Id: I355f24643dedce944a6ba3264767e92f1f43b94f

added_lines: from subprocess import ( check_call, check_output, CalledProcessError) 'enable_fwaas': { 'rel_key': 'enable-fwaas', 'default': False, }, if ctxt['enable_fwaas']: l3_extension_plugins.append('fwaas_v2') if ctxt['enable_nfg_logging']: l3_extension_plugins.append('fwaas_v2_log') """Formatted list of socket memory configuration per socket. :returns: socket memory configuration per socket. lscpu_out = check_output( ['lscpu', '-p=socket']).decode('UTF-8').strip() sockets = set() for line in lscpu_out.split('\n'): try: sockets.add(int(line)) except ValueError: # lscpu output is headed by comments so ignore them. pass mem_list = [str(sm_size) for _ in sockets]

commit_message:
Fix hostmonitor to respect quorum

Both cibadmin-based and crm_mon-based host status queryings were
affected, allowing partitioned cluster to tell Masakari to
evacuate hosts from the other partition (which nota bene include
all remotes if applicable).

Closes-Bug: #1878548
Change-Id: I0b1ca8a011ee4da162a2c3a986c1dab9a3d38190
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/masakari-monitors refs/changes/21/808821/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes hostmonitor reporting hosts down because of Pacemaker cluster partitioning. Now hostmonitor properly respects the status of Pacemaker cluster quorum. `LP#1878548 <https://launchpad.net/bugs/1878548>`__

commit_message:
Do not hard-code overcloud-full image name

The var overcloud_image defaults to overcloud-full, and will until the
switchover to the whole-disk overcloud.

Change-Id: I64c0d9f97b34e9145be70af7c489bb5b706baf8a
Blueprint: whole-disk-default

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-09-07 12:45:44.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1938326.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/058d137ac88ecd45bdf4095a31783886cf64f820', 'message': 'Add more retries to TestMigrateFromDownHost tests

We still having occasional failures in TestMigrateFromDownHost tests
where the compute is not observed down after stopping the service. There
was a fix I61fded6f513c18dbd0248ed54fc58a318dc05416 that increased the
CONF.service_down_time to 6 seconds. However the
_wait_for_service_parameter() helper by default uses 10 retries with 0.5
sec delays. This can be pretty close to the 6 seconds of service
timeout. This patch increase the number of retires to 20 avoid unstable
test runs.

Change-Id: Iad970fa3aa10aaa2c831a064c085c06fdc88305e
Closes-Bug: #1940741
'}]
commit_message:
Add more retries to TestMigrateFromDownHost tests

We still having occasional failures in TestMigrateFromDownHost tests
where the compute is not observed down after stopping the service. There
was a fix I61fded6f513c18dbd0248ed54fc58a318dc05416 that increased the
CONF.service_down_time to 6 seconds. However the
_wait_for_service_parameter() helper by default uses 10 retries with 0.5
sec delays. This can be pretty close to the 6 seconds of service
timeout. This patch increase the number of retires to 20 avoid unstable
test runs.

Change-Id: Iad970fa3aa10aaa2c831a064c085c06fdc88305e
Closes-Bug: #1940741
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/14/807714/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(gibi): extra retries are needed as the default 10 retries with # 0.5 second sleep is close to the 6 seconds down timeout }, max_retries=20, # NOTE(gibi): extra retries are needed as the default 10 retries with # 0.5 second sleep is close to the 6 seconds down timeout }, max_retries=20, # NOTE(gibi): extra retries are needed as the default 10 retries with # 0.5 second sleep is close to the 6 seconds down timeout 'src', 'nova-compute', {'state': 'down'}, max_retries=20)

commit_message:
Splits the `TestBaremetalProxy` class

Nine new classes `TestDrivers`, `TestChassis`, `TestNode`, `TestPort`, `TestPortGroups`, `TestAllocation`, `TestVolumeConnector`, `TestVolumeTarget`, and `TestMisc` are created. They contain all the tests previously embedded in `TestBaremetalProxy`.

In `TestBaremetalProxy`, only the `setUp` method remains

Change-Id: I055d571ac3b179679c58c1cddc86abc9fe63f5aa

commit_message:
Glance remote worker should use own cache directory

Earlier glance remote worker was using same cache directory used by
glance worker. Ideally both should use their own cache directory.

This patch makes provision for the same by setting different path
for image_cache_dir config option.

Change-Id: If2627e9c212fd765b96d925046c04e9cb1001c3d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/75/803875/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Point this worker to use different cache dir iniset $(glance_remote_conf "$GLANCE_API_CONF") DEFAULT \ image_cache_dir "${remote_data}/cache"

Add http basic auth support for neutron api

This adds basic_auth support to run neutron api
standalone.

Change-Id: I714ecce01afe3afc43d79a540a4634212250272e

commit_message:
Add ovmf package for uefi support

When creating an instance with uefi support it is looking for various
files that are typically provided by ovmf package. This is automatically
installed from train and above, but is lacking in queens. This will
solve it for any deployment.

Change-Id: I7665a596112d673624ea5edd7438b915834918df

commit_message:
Cleanup deprecated projects

This commit removes the following deprecated projects:

- monasca-log-api [1]
- monasca-transform [2]
- os-xenapi. This project is still supported by Nova, but it is no
  longer supported in Neutron and we are explicitly patching it out in
  Nova unit tests.
- oslosphinx. There are some old projects still requiring it, but we are
  patching them out.
- python-glareclient. While not officially abandoned, it has not been
  updated for several years, and no other package requires it.

[1] - https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-log-api/src/branch/master/README.rst
[2] - https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-transform/src/branch/master/README.rst

Change-Id: I62d960b47a9e65c595a587c8d832e8b1bd5cc748
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/96/807296/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: From 0b44c4d0805a1cc417f8d8e73e2885290ebf9ddf Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001 From: Thomas Bechtold <tbechtold@suse.com> Date: Wed, 4 Sep 2019 14:50:48 +0200 Subject: [PATCH] Switch to openstackdocstheme The current code does not work with python3.7 on openSUSE Tumbleweed. It fails with: Exception occurred: File ".tox/docs/lib/python3.7/site-packages/oslosphinx/__init__.py", \ line 76, in builder_inited app.info('Using openstack theme from %s' % theme_dir) AttributeError: 'Sphinx' object has no attribute 'info' Switching to openstackdocstheme and also calling sphinx-build directly instead of relying on the pbr doc build integration fixes that problem. commit_message:
Refactor parts of frr.py and add unittests

* Remove the bgp_as parameter from the _get_router_id() function as it
  wasn't used

* Run the run_vtysh_config() command using temporary files to avoid
  leaving the filesystem dirty when we run the OVN BGP Agent

* Fix logs to delay the interpolation

* Base test class to stop all mocks at the end of each test execution

Story: 2009165
Task: 43296

Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Idf37e2fd3305c5b4d8f5a4d2f57f781852938e13

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I579aefaef286970e3dcaffedc7942521c192ee06

subject: [Functional] Wait for the initial state of ha router before test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-09-09 13:13:26.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/b8ef8e722af761dd394064ab70e159aa05639e56', 'message': "[Functional] Wait for the initial state of ha router before test

In functional tests of the HA and DVR HA routers, when e.g.
failover is tested, we should always wait for routers to be in the
expected initial state (primary or backup) before router failover
will actually be done.
Without that, we may hit race condition when initial router's state
is enqueued but not processed yet and then state will be changed thus
no any action will be performed by L3 agent and test may fail.

Closes-Bug: #1939507
Change-Id: Ibd8f78fc822b04965c6a79b57b13be364934f64f
"}]
commit_message:
[Functional] Wait for the initial state of ha router before test

In functional tests of the HA and DVR HA routers, when e.g.
failover is tested, we should always wait for routers to be in the
expected initial state (primary or backup) before router failover
will actually be done.
Without that, we may hit race condition when initial router's state
is enqueued but not processed yet and then state will be changed thus
no any action will be performed by L3 agent and test may fail.

Closes-Bug: #1939507
Change-Id: Ibd8f78fc822b04965c6a79b57b13be364934f64f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/71/808071/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8304dfc005aae8472bce33591eade572136e7acc

subject: Add CephRbdTrashPurgeInterval parameter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-09-13 08:32:52.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/cephadm/ceph-base.yaml', 'ci/environments/scenario001-standalone.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/09b2b0554232fc29b45c472c20e8203f25967ec0', 'message': 'Add CephRbdTrashPurgeInterval parameter

When ceph is deployed via TripleO, during the overcloud deployment
phase the tripleo_cephadm role is able to add a new trash purge
scheduler. This change exposes the tripleo CephRbdTrashPurgeInterval
which defines the interval that will be applied to the scheduler.

commit_message:
Add CephRbdTrashPurgeInterval parameter

When ceph is deployed via TripleO, during the overcloud deployment
phase the tripleo_cephadm role is able to add a new trash purge
scheduler. This change exposes the tripleo CephRbdTrashPurgeInterval
which defines the interval that will be applied to the scheduler.

Depends-On: Ide51ba4cef7c9f0df78d505f7429745285d7d484
Change-Id: I6d560bbd67958ec484248ad0b20ef30f1f9593b8
(cherry picked from commit fcfa8ac23ba0b9c2900a16de981da68ab9221619)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/51/808651/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make "killed" images list available using the CLI

Images in "killed" status weren't able to list by using
CLI even if using "--property status=killed". Fisrt, It is
not reasonable that the argument "status=killed" could be
accepted but not effective. Besides, when the image_id is
known the details can be shown and they can be deleted. It
also is a contradiction. If an user can't list "killed"
images, he doesn't know the image_id.

The filtering for the "killed" status was cancelled.

Users can list Images in "killed" status using CLI——
"openstack image list".

Closes-Bug: #1924612
Change-Id: Icb373fd09ebae32edf6b60e6536562ccb9a1342d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/34/806134/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: image_statuses = [s for s in STATUSES if s != 'killed']

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I12a97ab09cc76180e9e55db0052c2fe986abeb9d

Add rbd trash purge scheduler to the Ceph conf

trash purge scheduler passing an interval as parameter.

commit_message:
db: Add alembic boilerplate

This is mostly generated using 'alembic init', with some minor changes
to ensure we add a license to generated scripts (to keep hacking happy)
and don't generate a downgrade step (which we don't support).

Change-Id: I9380af78f397c552244d7cac4a8131df1ff65d91
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/30/786930/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # A generic, single database configuration. [alembic] # path to migration scripts script_location = %(here)s # template used to generate migration files # file_template = %%(rev)s_%%(slug)s # timezone to use when rendering the date # within the migration file as well as the filename. # string value is passed to dateutil.tz.gettz() # leave blank for localtime # timezone = # max length of characters to apply to the # "slug" field # truncate_slug_length = 40 # set to 'true' to run the environment during # the 'revision' command, regardless of autogenerate # revision_environment = false # set to 'true' to allow .pyc and .pyo files without # a source .py file to be detected as revisions in the # versions/ directory # sourceless = false # version location specification; this defaults # to cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrations/versions. When using multiple version # directories, initial revisions must be specified with --version-path # version_locations = %(here)s/bar %(here)s/bat cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrations/versions # the output encoding used when revision files # are written from script.py.mako # output_encoding = utf-8 # Uncomment and update to your sql connection string if wishing to run # alembic directly from command line # sqlalchemy.url = driver://user:pass@localhost/dbname [post_write_hooks] # post_write_hooks defines scripts or Python functions that are run # on newly generated revision scripts. See the documentation for further # detail and examples # format using "black" - use the console_scripts runner, against the "black" entrypoint # hooks=black # black.type=console_scripts # black.entrypoint=black # black.options=-l 79 # Logging configuration [loggers] keys = root,sqlalchemy,alembic [handlers] keys = console [formatters] keys = generic [logger_root] level = WARN handlers = console qualname = [logger_sqlalchemy] level = WARN handlers = qualname = sqlalchemy.engine [logger_alembic] level = INFO handlers = qualname = alembic [handler_console] class = StreamHandler args = (sys.stderr,) level = NOTSET formatter = generic [formatter_generic] format = %(levelname)-5.5s [%(name)s] %(message)s datefmt = %H:%M:%S

Also removes the following from tests/unit/policy.yaml, which do not
appear to be used anywere, but which interfere with these tests:
-"group:get_all": ""
-"group:get": ""
-"group:update": ""
-"group:delete": ""

Co-Authored-by: Rajat Dhasmana <rajatdhasmana@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I4216a0c1d562fca1b99027fdd67f8f3aaa134514
'}]
commit_message:
Implement Xena personas for volume groups

This change starts implementing secure RBAC by adopting common default
roles provided by keystone, namly the reader role for read-only support.

Also removes the following from tests/unit/policy.yaml, which do not
appear to be used anywere, but which interfere with these tests:
-"group:get_all": ""
-"group:get": ""
-"group:update": ""
-"group:delete": ""

Co-Authored-by: Rajat Dhasmana <rajatdhasmana@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I4216a0c1d562fca1b99027fdd67f8f3aaa134514

commit_message:
Implement project personas for the limits API

This commit ensures both system administrators (e.g., project-admins)
and project users can access the limits API.

Future changes will incorporate full system-scope support when cinder
has the necessary plumbing to support system-scope.

Co-Authored-by: Alan Bishop <abishop@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I77db7bc9e14b4554ce72850ba5065aad0befaa92

commit_message:
Remove setting ACLs during Upgrade

Currently, we are setting file ACLs on /var/lib/neutron as part of
upgrade tasks if there is a neutron user in the system. Since moving to
containerized deployment, we don't have neutron user on the system
anymore. This code was added to resolve issues arising with existing
neutron resources when moving from system services to containerized
services.

This patch is to remove the stale upgrade tasks to remove file ACLs.

Closes-Bug: #1943034

Signed-off-by: Purandhar Sairam Mannidi <pmannidi@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I19f457a99dedfd781bd56987e3fea6626737500d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/74/807974/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: post_upgrade_tasks: - name: Check for neutron user getent: database: passwd key: neutron fail_key: false - name: Set neutron_user_avail set_fact: neutron_user_avail: "{{ getent_passwd is defined }}" - when: - step|int == 2 - neutron_user_avail|bool block: - name: Ensure r/w access for existing files after upgrade become: true shell: | umask 0002 setfacl -d -R -m u:neutron:rwx /var/lib/neutron setfacl -R -m u:neutron:rw /var/lib/neutron find /var/lib/neutron -type d -exec setfacl -m u:neutron:rwx '{}' \; - name: Provide access to domain sockets become: true shell: | umask 0002 setfacl -m u:neutron:rwx "{{ item }}" with_items: - /var/lib/neutron/metadata_proxy - /var/lib/neutron/keepalived-state-change - /var/lib/neutron # These files are not necessarily present failed_when: false

commit_message:
Allow purging policy files

This change introduces the new purge_config parameter to the policy
class so that any policy rules not managed by puppet manifests can be
cleared.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/802305
Change-Id: I75e1d315c4cd4c161582a42495877c80ed57b350
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/36/807436/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*purge_config*] # (optional) Whether to set only the specified policy rules in the policy # file. # Defaults to false. # $purge_config = false, $policy_parameters = { policies => $policies, policy_path => $policy_path, file_user => 'root', file_group => $::glance::params::group, file_format => 'yaml', purge_config => $purge_config, } create_resources('openstacklib::policy', { $policy_path => $policy_parameters }) oslo::policy { 'glance_config':
deleted_lines: Openstacklib::Policy::Base { file_path => $policy_path, file_user => 'root', file_group => $::glance::params::group, file_format => 'yaml', } create_resources('openstacklib::policy::base', $policies) oslo::policy { 'glance_api_config':

commit_message:
Set memcached server list from memcached_node_names

This follows other clustered services (like RabbitMQ) and
uses *_node_names (which contain FQDNs), instead of *_node_ips.

Certificate for Memcached TLS is also created using FQDN.
Because of this, validation failed when using pymemcache.
This patch fixes this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1929574
Change-Id: I9d0ddcc88098a5b891829192f1ce656842d0aa15
(cherry picked from commit 49921d57f5753dffe032b9501d1101707ce8cc1e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/99/803199/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # === Parameters ## [*memcached_hosts*] # (Optional) Array of hostnames, ipv4 or ipv6 addresses for memcache. # Defaults to hiera('memcached_node_names', [])# DEPRECATED PARAMETERS # # [*memcached_ips*] # (Optional) Array of ipv4 or ipv6 addresses for memcache. # Defaults to undef # $memcached_hosts = hiera('memcached_node_names', []), # DEPRECATED PARAMETERS $memcached_ips = undef ) { $memcached_hosts_real = pick($memcached_ips, $memcached_hosts) if is_ipv6_address($memcached_hosts_real[0]) { $memcache_servers = prefix(suffix(any2array(normalize_ip_for_uri($memcached_hosts_real)), ":${memcached_port}"), 'inet6:') } else { $memcache_servers = suffix(any2array(normalize_ip_for_uri($memcached_hosts_real)), ":${memcached_port}")
deleted_lines: # [*memcached_ips*] # (Optional) Array of ipv4 or ipv6 addresses for memcache. # Defaults to hiera('memcached_node_ips', []) $memcached_ips = hiera('memcached_node_ips', []),) { if is_ipv6_address($memcached_ips[0]) { $memcache_servers = prefix(suffix(any2array(normalize_ip_for_uri($memcached_ips)), ":${memcached_port}"), 'inet6:') } else { $memcache_servers = suffix(any2array(normalize_ip_for_uri($memcached_ips)), ":${memcached_port}")

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for snapshot actions

This patch updates the policies for snapshot actions to align with
the policy persona matrix established for Xena.

Change-Id: Id739c462ffba60328524b3b0b46bbc0ff3a6e2c2

commit_message:
Test glance with cinder backend optimization

Configure a gate job for glance using a cinder glance_store
with cinder configured to clone image data directly in the backend
instead of transferring data through glance.

Change-Id: I8a193b1cd6002e11db78c8eebceaa2fbc86a90bc

added_lines: - cinder-for-glance-optimized: voting: false irrelevant-files: *gate-irrelevant-files - job: name: cinder-for-glance-optimized parent: tempest-integrated-storage description: | The regular tempest-integrated-storage job but with glance configured with cinder as a backend for multiple glance cinder stores and with cinder configured to use the optimized workflow of moving image data directly in the backend. vars: devstack_localrc: USE_CINDER_FOR_GLANCE: True GLANCE_ENABLE_MULTIPLE_STORES: True CINDER_ENABLED_BACKENDS: lvm:lvmdriver-1,lvm:lvmdriver-2 GLANCE_CINDER_DEFAULT_BACKEND: lvmdriver-1 GLANCE_SHOW_DIRECT_URL: True GLANCE_SHOW_MULTIPLE_LOCATIONS: True CINDER_ALLOWED_DIRECT_URL_SCHEMES: cinder

commit_message:
Remove support for TSM backup driver

... because it was deprecated during Wallaby[1], and the actual
implementation was already removed from cinder[2].

[1] e242bd747d88ea6a4e77bca7a6f617bbea02b5e4
[2] cddcc6e5073ec891b4d7aa4191fab56a05c74089

Change-Id: I8e2eec077e65fb7fa08f5e034295798c341ed67a

commit_message:
Implement project personas for attachments

This commit converts the policies for attachments to use
default roles from keystone and proper scope types.

Co-Authored-by: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Alan Bishop <abishop@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I467a74dfe321e61d935e8e101dc23c3fc8d74d19

commit_message:
Implement project personas for volume API

This patch updates project-level volume APIs and add respective tests.
This is inline with a series of changes across OpenStack to provide more
secure and consistent authroization defaults.

Co-Authored-by: Rajat Dhasmana <rajatdhasmana@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I3357f0fc8631e8c3a77aff4d07cb52190e8eddf5

subject: Update project personas for default_types
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-09-01 21:49:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/05d4f3b02f594e3c3bb72cbd169099bafef1fed2', 'message': "Update project personas for default_types

The default_types policies previously had initial support for system
and project scoped personas. However, cinder won't support scopes in
Xena. The scoping aspects of the default_types policies are removed
until support for scopes is added in Yoga.

Change-Id: I9d0a6994d92033539d39a1ce2403c12b69511712
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2021-09-03 06:18:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/fea077ebb231cb2b3b7c9edb605b496c559d3e11', 'message': "Update project personas for default_types

The default_types policies previously had initial support for system
and project scoped personas. However, cinder won't support scopes in
Xena. The scoping aspects of the default_types policies are removed
until support for scopes is added in Yoga.

Change-Id: I9d0a6994d92033539d39a1ce2403c12b69511712
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2021-09-07 15:29:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/804ef65775ef1dbe458d03422f7d6c6c9fc16c24', 'message': "Update project personas for default_types

The default_types policies previously had initial support for system
and project scoped personas. However, cinder won't support scopes in
Xena. The scoping aspects of the default_types policies are removed
until support for scopes is added in Yoga.

Some functional and unit tests are deleted in favor of new tests that
use the secure-rbac test framework.

Change-Id: I9d0a6994d92033539d39a1ce2403c12b69511712
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2021-09-07 18:21:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/a1bcbfe8cbac43ac1509e0f00cdab9e2c84eca86', 'message': "Update project personas for default_types

The default_types policies previously had initial support for system
and project scoped personas. However, cinder won't support scopes in
Xena. The scoping aspects of the default_types policies are removed

commit_message:
Update project personas for default_types

The default_types policies previously had initial support for system
and project scoped personas. However, cinder won't support scopes in
Xena. The scoping aspects of the default_types policies are removed
until support for scopes is added in Yoga.

Some functional and unit tests are deleted in favor of new tests that
use the secure-rbac test framework.

Co-Authored-by: Rajat Dhasmana <rajatdhasmana@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I9d0a6994d92033539d39a1ce2403c12b69511712

commit_message:
Implement project personas for volume transfers

This commit updates the policies for volume transfers to use the default
roles provided from keystone. It also adds respective RBAC tests.

Future changes will incorporate system-scope support for the
administrative actions when cinder fully supports system-scope.

Co-Authored-by: Rajat Dhasmana <rajatdhasmana@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ib18858595507a9e59d95a0e139d566341431268c

commit_message:
CI: Fix get_logs.sh docker logs output

Currently the logs get printed in Zuul job stdout and only a small portion
of them is redirected to a file - this patch changes that to send all output
to desired files.

Change-Id: I45e937ec7c102e89edee20679b8959bf7f6c7152
(cherry picked from commit 923813ac4820044723814b777e4a39cb6eb273fe)

commit_message:
Change the way to get interface name

This patch changes the way to get interface name.
With this fix, bash hostmonitor gets it by using ip route instead of ifconfig.
And it won't fail to get the interface name on RHEL.

Change-Id: I483e130029c30b960eb6d55f288435c4c570af0a
Closes-Bug: #1762958
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/masakari-monitors refs/changes/24/560324/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: TMP_IP_ROUTE_FILE="$TMP_DIR/ip_route.tmp" if [ -e $TMP_IP_ROUTE_FILE ]; then sudo rm -rf $TMP_IP_ROUTE_FILE if [ -e $TMP_IP_ROUTE_FILE ]; then sudo rm -rf $TMP_IP_ROUTE_FILE sudo ip route > ${TMP_IP_ROUTE_FILE} if [ `grep "${BIND_NET_ADDR}" ${TMP_IP_ROUTE_FILE} | wc -l` -eq 0 ]; then MCAST_NIC=`grep "${BIND_NET_ADDR}" ${TMP_IP_ROUTE_FILE} | awk '{print $3}'`
deleted_lines: TMP_IFCONFIG_FILE="$TMP_DIR/ifconfig.tmp" if [ -e $TMP_IFCONFIG_FILE ]; then sudo rm -rf $TMP_IFCONFIG_FILE if [ -e $TMP_IFCONFIG_FILE ]; then sudo rm -rf $TMP_IFCONFIG_FILE BIND_NET_ADDR=`echo ${BIND_NET_ADDR} | sed -e 's/\.0$//g'` sudo ifconfig > ${TMP_IFCONFIG_FILE} if [ `grep "${BIND_NET_ADDR}" ${TMP_IFCONFIG_FILE} | wc -l` -eq 0 ]; then S_LINES=`cat ${TMP_IFCONFIG_FILE} | grep -n -e "^[a-z]" -e "^[0-9]" | cut -d":" -f1` E_LINE_DEFAULT=`cat -n ${TMP_IFCONFIG_FILE} | tail -n 1 | awk '{print $1}'` for S_LINE in ${S_LINES} do S_LINE=`expr ${S_LINE} + 1` E_LINE=`cat ${TMP_IFCONFIG_FILE} | tail -n +${S_LINE} | egrep -n -m 1 -e "^[a-z]" -e "^[0-9]" | cut -d":" -f1` if [ -z "${E_LINE}" ]; then E_LINE=${E_LINE_DEFAULT} else E_LINE=`expr ${S_LINE} + ${E_LINE} - 1 - 1` fi if [ `cat ${TMP_IFCONFIG_FILE} | sed -n "${S_LINE},${E_LINE}p" | grep "${BIND_NET_ADDR}" | wc -l` -ne 0 ]; then break fi done S_LINE=`expr ${S_LINE} - 1` MCAST_NIC=`cat -n ${TMP_IFCONFIG_FILE} | grep " ${S_LINE}" | awk '{print $2}'`

commit_message:
Proposing Xena RC1 for masakari

This proposed a RC1 release for masakari to get any merged changes
out prior to the RC1 deadline for Xena going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Thursday, September 16.

17c4829 [CI] Gate on voting jobs
25f64a0 [DevStack] Do not use the sample process list
7b47a2a Generate PDF documentation
c861437 Set "disabled reason" for compute service.

5c6fd44 Fix Masakari API to properly return error codes

47341ef Add the functional job to periodic
44cae8a [community goal] Update contributor documentation
d51cefe uuid in log information

e5246e2 Make unit tests compatible with SQLAlchemy 1.4
b547219 Ussuri+ is python3 only and update python to python3

676d407 Add Python3 xena unit tests
f324724 Update master for stable/wallaby
33f8425 Remove a sample file of masakari.conf

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Prevents the wrong notification when only own node is offline

This patch fixed the code so that hostmonitor doesn't monitor
pacemaker_remote nodes when own node is offline.
By this fix, when own node is isolated in the network, the hostmonitor
won't throw failure notifications about the healthy node.

Change-Id: Id9c08e0cfc4b4063e0fd70b5264bc1977a912937
Closes-Bug: #1878548

commit_message:
Implement Xena project personas for volume types

Implements the 3 Xena personas (no system scope).  Also:
- introduces new policies for volume-type create, update, and delete
  and deprecates the old "types manage" rule
- deprecates rule 'volume_extension:volume_type_encryption'

Co-authored-by: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I52de98d80e80e2c315c6e329a9ead6f83713eca2

commit_message:
Ensure members are deleted from pools when there is no endpoints

This patch ensures that endpoints scale down to 0 event is handled
and therefore members are deleted from the loadbalancer pool

Change-Id: Idb879245607a6f0f914a44220312d54aa40e2e3d
Closes-Bug: 1904395

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-08-18 09:56:48.000000000', 'files': ['common/deploy-steps.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/1caf542927e620e2fd8b68ed2a51ca13217bb88c', 'message': 'Update, avoid task skipping by directly importing step file.

During update we skip a lot tasks because we loop over the same update
step task file, changing the step variable, wasting time and
clobbering logs.

To solve the skipped tasks this, we now loop over the stepX file
generated for update and post update.

Expanding the playbook to import the tasks and setting the step
variable has another benefit.  It opens the possibility to use
"start-at-tasks" as everything is imported.  Using loop variable and
include_tasks prevented its usage.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/740465
(cherry picked from commit 2c1db9ed05d9cd4ffe64419a22751272af139c0f)

Change-Id: I368f75a1c20928b825a7b055af6313e0a0f030c6
'}]
commit_message:
Update, avoid task skipping by directly importing step file.

During update we skip a lot tasks because we loop over the same update
step task file, changing the step variable, wasting time and
clobbering logs.

To solve the skipped tasks this, we now loop over the stepX file
generated for update and post update.

Expanding the playbook to import the tasks and setting the step
variable has another benefit.  It opens the possibility to use
"start-at-tasks" as everything is imported.  Using loop variable and
include_tasks prevented its usage.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/740465
(cherry picked from commit 2c1db9ed05d9cd4ffe64419a22751272af139c0f)

Change-Id: I368f75a1c20928b825a7b055af6313e0a0f030c6

commit_message:
Revert "Add victoria support for emit_releases_file.py"

This reverts commit d69df19d22148f95ee5d38af22dfe93936e4407d.
We need to revert this until we actually branch Victoria
otherwise it fails the master upgrade jobs. See comments at
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/753403/ for info.

Once we branch Victoria we can revert this revert.

Change-Id: I7ddc8bc766e028608f9b82df5129678385914c43

commit_message:
WIP: SRIOV workload can be created with PF or VF ports

New input parameter --upgrade-workloadsriovtype
Allowed values: direct, direct-physical or both

Change-Id: Ib5c1e9798427ff70a21f50f8722aa53ece721026

commit_message:
WIP Fix openstack module import

Ansible 2.10.0 has moved the openstack module to a new
collection. This fixes the imports. But I guess
can't be used till 2.10.0 packages are availble for
centos8 and rhel8 for non pip installs.

Closes-Bug: #1896738
Change-Id: Ia205c8bde3210cde5755ae1f5485020d77771009

commit_message:
[TRAIN-ONLY] Update train tests to ensure we're not failing py27 tox

While py27 tox is not currently voting, we're still testing with it.
This change will resolve the long standing issue where py27 lint
tests are always failing.

Change-Id: Ie71b52d8a66f92723c03e400225ce4deda6c3176
Closes-Bug: #1894841
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add an upgrade job to tripleo-ansible.

As tripleo-ansible contains more and more of the main workflow of ooo,
we need to add some more coverage.  Here we add a non-voting upgrade
related job.

The depends on is a fix to the multinode standalone upgrade.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/755312

Change-Id: If72874b21a266722e467af39bb2809636e3e64a2

commit_message:
DNM TESTING Deprecate Keepalived service

We don't deploy Keepalived in multi-node as our HA story is done with
Pacemaker. Therefore, we don't use VRRP protocol that Keepalived
provides to maintain the VIPs alive, so we don't really need this
service.

Instead, we can configure the VIPs on the br-ctlplane interface which
already handled the local_ip. Now it also handles the configuration of
public ip and admin ip.

Keepalived is now deprecated and will be removed in the next cycle.

(cherry picked from commit c712355e4bae4ef2fc1b83e5603c0364dbd50a78)
blueprint replace-keepalived-undercloud
Change-Id: I3192be07cb6c19d5e26cb4cddbe68213e7e48937

commit_message:
[WIP] Add the possibility to run subscription command individually.

This would offer the possibility to run subscription commands before
running the update.  This enable the user to do some pre-tasks before
running the update like running a yum download on all the node before
the update window and thus speed up the process.

The undercloud part is not clear, as heat compilation and ansible run
are intermixed, I just put it there as an idea (maybe
a openstack undercloud upgrade --compile-playbooks options to be able
to create new playbooks without running the update, maybe such command
already exist ...)

The overcloud part is more easy as we have the

   openstack overcloud update prepare

command.

We could just then run something like:

   openstack overcloud external-update run --tags rhsm-subscription-overcloud

and then we would need something like:

   openstack overcloud update run --skip-subscription --limit ...

or maybe being able to pass down skip tags ?

Change-Id: I09df4b2cf3faa83b8e14e5a00a9635abfc21af4e

commit_message:
WIP DNM - Deprecate PacemakerRemoteAuthkey

With pcs >= 0.10 we started delegating authkey creation to pcs itself
(puppet-pacemaker commit fde568564d43c78bf2828d3c981d5cc685fb3369) that
in turn switched to 256 bytes keys to allow for FIPS mode to be enabled.
See rhbz#1740218 for additional details on the pcs change.

This commit removes PacemakerRemoteAuthkey from the secrets to be
generated by tripleo.

depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/741130

Change-Id: Id87dbde14bc37eaf336939b86b733beaa1b2e022
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/28/741128/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Run Update without mistral workflow in CI

Force to run update without mistral action.
This option is default in master, we have it in Train but no tested.
This option should be tested in CI, ortherwise
it will be broken

subject: Add a note about HA in podman.yaml
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-04-14 15:02:46.000000000', 'files': ['environments/podman.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/a2998176f0c14265bef5240c33fb7d8a99c0bad8', 'message': "Add a note about HA in podman.yaml

I recently started deploying tripleo on CentOS 8 and I replaced my
docker.yaml and docker-ha.yaml environment files with podman.yaml. I
noticed issues during my overcloud deployment due to rabbit being
misconfigured:

  could not start kernel pid (application_controller) (invalid config
  data: application: rabbit; duplicate parameter:
  cluster_partition_handling)

This is because I assumed podman.yaml to contain everything I needed
for an HA deployment. Instead, I need to use docker-ha.yaml, which uses
podman as the ContainerCli, despite the name. It also contains all the
necesary configuration for rabbit and pacemaker in highly-available
environments (so you don't hit the error above).

This commit adds a note to the podman.yaml environment that describes
how it is useful for standalone deployments and points people to
docker-ha.yaml if they're looking for HA support.

Change-Id: Iff525db59bccbead8ea5085ca7b3122d3c530287
"}]
commit_message:
Add a note about HA in podman.yaml

I recently started deploying tripleo on CentOS 8 and I replaced my
docker.yaml and docker-ha.yaml environment files with podman.yaml. I
noticed issues during my overcloud deployment due to rabbit being
misconfigured:

  could not start kernel pid (application_controller) (invalid config
  data: application: rabbit; duplicate parameter:
  cluster_partition_handling)

This is because I assumed podman.yaml to contain everything I needed
for an HA deployment. Instead, I need to use docker-ha.yaml, which uses
podman as the ContainerCli, despite the name. It also contains all the
necesary configuration for rabbit and pacemaker in highly-available
environments (so you don't hit the error above).

This commit adds a note to the podman.yaml environment that describes
how it is useful for standalone deployments and points people to
docker-ha.yaml if they're looking for HA support.

Change-Id: Iff525db59bccbead8ea5085ca7b3122d3c530287
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/01/720001/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # NOTE: This environment is useful for standalone deployments. You might notice # issues using this environment in clustered environments where you have # multiple controllers because it lacks the necessary variables to setup rabbit # and pacemaker. If you're deploying a highly-available environment, you might # consider looking at docker-ha.yaml.

commit_message:
Skip openvswitch restart if overcloud-minimal is used

openvswitch package is not installed in overcloud-minimal and
upgrade fails due to this service restart.  This patch avoids
restarting openvswitch if the openvswitch package is not installed.

Change-Id: I59cdebb1ff8b3c4625ad8f53c444db63b3418092
Closes-bug: #1875743

commit_message:
WIP: Add fips package to base container packages

Since the undercloud is containerized, we need to enable FIPS at the
container-level to achieve FIPS compliance.

This commit adds the FIPS package to the base container packages.

Change-Id: I71ab6447338d81fb5e6b665cbe66fa4ed79a4de1

commit_message:
Update hide sensitive data to be dynamic

This change will unmask our no-log options if either the global
"hide_sensitive_logs" is set to `true` or if the internal ansible
verbosity is set to a value greater than or equal to 3.

Change-Id: Iada751672788da557f1b5b7e68446bedd6c5d6db
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

added_lines: default: 0 When Debug or LibvirtDebug is true defaults to 1, otherwise defaults to 3. - range: { min: 0, max: 4 } Debug: type: boolean default: false description: Set to True to enable debugging on all services. LibvirtDebug: type: boolean default: false description: Set to True to enable debug logging for libvirt. conditions: log_level_notset: equals: - {get_param: LibvirtLogLevel} - 0 libvirt_debug: or: - equals: - {get_param: LibvirtDebug} - true - equals: - {get_param: Debug} - true LEVEL: if: - log_level_notset - if: - libvirt_debug - 1 - 3 - {get_param: LibvirtLogLevel}
deleted_lines: default: 3 - range: { min: 1, max: 4 } LEVEL: {get_param: LibvirtLogLevel}

tempest_public_net_name variable is used by tempest
to define public network name. In ironic default
network is "provisioning" network. To run ironic
tempest tests we need to create same network which
is defined in the ironic.conf. It will avoid modifying
network name in ironic.conf and other files.

This changes are going to reflect in
triplo-ci-centos-8-scenario012-standalone job.

commit_message:
[DNM] Making tempest_public_net_name variable ovarridable.

tempest_public_net_name variable is used by tempest
to define public network name. In ironic default
network is "provisioning" network. To run ironic
tempest tests we need to create same network which
is defined in the ironic.conf. It will avoid modifying
network name in ironic.conf and other files.

This changes are going to reflect in
triplo-ci-centos-8-scenario012-standalone job.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/720705/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/731704/

Change-Id: I266c53c8a2e0461defb8167cdd96a8f02a763e7c
Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Use stack environment for container image prepare

Use stack environment when availabe, this will help us avoid
doing avoid updating role data to remove OS::Heat::None
services multiple times.

Change-Id: I915743879ccb3b69fae32880d8047dd0e13e3fbd

commit_message:
Centos8 undercloud upgrade - rename & split ussuri voting/gating

This splits the centos8 undercloud upgrade job to master/ussuri
versions. The ussui one should be voting but blocked on related
bug below. Tracked by tripleo-ci at [1]. Also drops the
'containerized' bit from the name.

[1] https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1817
Related-Bug: 1888411

Change-Id: I75d9f3f8541e18e171b9f48e4f40e1bc6ce57c04

commit_message:
move periodic defs to periodic.yml

Just organizing where periodic jobs are defined.
If periodic jobs are in a zuul template they can
run more than once at the same time.

Change-Id: Ic022a09cfa2c6cf097268d16346f63e04d658406

commit_message:
[WIP] Remove deprecated files and parameters.

These have either been stated to be removed in Train (or an earlier
release) or have been deprecated for over a year. These file have
newer alternative templates/parameters or are no longer used.

Change-Id: I72ea326aa4ae4fe501fd133a0764c72e05ed0e01
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Expose the Apache WSGI timeout

This applies to all OpenStack services managed by Puppet.

Also increase the timeout from 60 to 600 seconds for the
Undercloud, UndercloudMinion, and Standalone composable roles
where the API response times are slower.

Aodh
Depends-On: Ic5055279770342d244ef3a4592067351981b459a

commit_message:
WIP: Speed up plan operations by using a tarball in swift.

Use a tarball in swift instead of the expanded archive to
speed up plan operations using swift.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Brad P. Crochet <brad@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I21caef1a3e6206d6c427140fd28b5f2ea6c68ef0

subject: Ensure LANG env is properly set when puppet runs.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-09-25 11:52:28.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/ansible_plugins/modules/container_puppet_config.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/a78c62cc60afd7589b0756a3d09b3bda37b4aa5e', 'message': 'Ensure LANG env is properly set when puppet runs.

We need to ensure that proper locale are passed down to the puppet
process.

Puppet modules related to openstack actively read the openstack
database.  The default locale in a container is "C", so any "UTF-8"
related character in the database will make puppet fail.

Here we offer:
 - a way for the user to override it completly (not recommanded, but
   maybe it has a use)
 - if nothing is provided they we chack the running env for any locale
   and if everything fail we set it to a saner than "C" default.

Change-Id: Iea6798ffdc961e91f3d8700f7d415eb01c579b52
Closes-Bug: #1896640
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure LANG env is properly set when puppet runs.

We need to ensure that proper locale are passed down to the puppet
process.

Puppet modules related to openstack actively read the openstack
database.  The default locale in a container is "C", so any "UTF-8"
related character in the database will make puppet fail.

Here we offer:
 - a way for the user to override it completly (not recommanded, but
   maybe it has a use)
 - if nothing is provided they we chack the running env for any locale
   and if everything fail we set it to a saner than "C" default.

Change-Id: Iea6798ffdc961e91f3d8700f7d415eb01c579b52
Closes-Bug: #1896640
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/58/754358/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: locale: description: - Override default locale for the puppet run in the container type: str default: os.environ['LANG']|'en_US.UTF-8'DEFAULT_LANG = 'en_US.UTF-8' self.lang = args['locale'] if self.lang is None: if 'LANG' in os.environ and os.environ['LANG']: self.lang = os.environ['LANG'] else: self.lang = DEFAULT_LANG 'LANG': self.lang, return returned_env

commit_message:
AllNodesValidationConfig fails on multiple host groups

Fix the way how AllNodesValidationConfig handle more complex host
groups, when some rubish is passed to Python one-line script which
validates IP addresses.

Change-Id: I2e6ad28b90032a4948f2bad2a1fa2dc2aa9d01bf
Closes-Bug: #1896200

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Add option to report storage provisioned capacity

This patch adds option ´netapp_driver_reports_provisioned_capacity´,
for driver to calculate the storage provisioned capacity by queryng
volume sizes directly from the storage system and reporting as a
pool capability ´provisioned_capacity_gb´, instead of relying
on the default behavior of using scheduler and volume service
internal states as done by ´allocated_capacity_gb´.

Implements: blueprint ontap-report-provisioned-capacity
Change-Id: I97625de865a63b0cf725f61d9d2ea3c44740d9e7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/98/798198/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'storage space is allocated on demand.')), cfg.BoolOpt('netapp_driver_reports_provisioned_capacity', default=False, help=('Set to True for Cinder to query the storage system in ' 'order to calculate volumes provisioned size, otherwise ' 'provisioned_capacity_gb will corresponds to the ' 'value of allocated_capacity_gb (calculated by Cinder ' 'Core code). Enabling this feature increases ' 'the number of API calls to the storage and ' 'requires more processing on host, which may impact ' 'volume report overall performance.')), ]

commit_message:
[senlin-tempest-plugin] Tag train-last

Train branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. Tempest and
tempest plugins are branchless which means master version of
Tempest and its plugins is used to test the supported stable
branches.

Once any stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and
its plugins compatible tag[2] needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with that tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[3].

Tagging 'train-last'[4] as well as a new version also with same hash.

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/train/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html
[4] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#extended-maintenance

Change-Id: Ib0de1dfb95a29264828c8315e1b6eb212eb8db9d

commit_message:
Secure boot requires SMM feature enabled

See following error in nova-compute.log when secure boot is enabled:

libvirt.libvirtError: unsupported configuration: Secure boot requires SMM feature enabled

With "<os firmware='efi'>", libvirt will automatically enable SMM
and the features in libvirtl xml will eventually look like:

  <features>
    <acpi/>
    <apic/>
    <smm state='on'/>
  </features>

Change-Id: Ifd0e6c700a470f03468cf406f560735a3cbfc8c5

commit_message:
Add missing share-type user message

Attempting to create a share without identifying a share type results in an
error.This adds a user message informing the user that no default share type
was identified while attempting to create a share.

Closes-Bug: #1870280

Change-Id: Ib417499d4394b939eb289460ac8dbb6b22d789f4
(cherry picked from commit 657fa5b113ce1c0cd35a21d7eac4d446af9ce2d3)

commit_message:
Deprecate PacemakerRemoteAuthkey

With pcs >= 0.10 we started delegating authkey creation to pcs itself
(puppet-pacemaker commit fde568564d43c78bf2828d3c981d5cc685fb3369) that
in turn switched to 256 bytes keys to allow for FIPS mode to be enabled.
See rhbz#1740218 for additional details on the pcs change.

This commit removes PacemakerRemoteAuthkey in line with the respective
tripleo-common change: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/741128.

Change-Id: I11acc935b4ff51aa038dad953fb3d70780276db7

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I437cd8a60ca168732ea0e2872f725248dbf75ab1

commit_message:
WIP -- Use validations-libs for callback and logging

PoC for the spec for the use of validations-libs in
tripleoclient for logging and the callback

I removed the unit tests explicitly because I want to
see the CI jobs running. I will re-add and fix then later

Change-Id: I1fe070ea3c484d11e085e9baff52284eaebba55d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/89/724289/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from validations_libs.ansible import Ansible as vf_ansible from validations_libs import utils as v_utils _uuid, artifacts_dir = v_utils.create_artifacts_dir( prefix=os.path.basename(playbook)) run_ansible = vf_ansible(_uuid) _playbook, _rc, _status = run_ansible.run( workdir=artifacts_dir, playbook=playbook, playbook_dir=workdir, parallel_run=True, inventory=inventory, output_callback='validation_json', quiet=quiet, extra_vars=extra_vars, limit_hosts=limit_hosts, extra_env_variables=extra_env_variables, ansible_cfg=ansible_cfg, gathering_policy='explicit', ansible_artifact_path=artifacts_dir) return _rc, _status

import pwd import reimport ansible_runner """Simple wrapper for ansible-playbook. :param playbook: Playbook filename. :type playbook: String :param inventory: Either proper inventory file, or a coma-separated list. :type inventory: String :param workdir: Location of the working directory. :type workdir: String :param playbook_dir: Location of the playbook directory. (defaults to workdir). :type playbook_dir: String :param connection: Connection type (local, smart, etc). :type connection: String :param output_callback: Callback for output format. Defaults to "json". :type output_callback: String :param callback_whitelist: Comma separated list of callback plugins. Defaults to the value of `output_callback`. When the verbosity is > 0 "profile_tasks" will also be whitelisted. :type callback_whitelist: String :param ssh_user: User for the ssh connection. :type ssh_user: String :param key: Private key to use for the ssh connection. :type key: String :param module_path: Location of the ansible module and library. :type module_path: String :param limit_hosts: Limit the execution to the hosts. :type limit_hosts: String :param tags: Run specific tags. :type tags: String :param skip_tags: Skip specific tags. :type skip_tags: String :param verbosity: Verbosity level for Ansible execution. :type verbosity: Integer :param quiet: Disable all output (Defaults to False) :type quiet: Boolean :param extra_vars: Set additional variables as a Dict or the absolute path of a JSON or YAML file type. :type extra_vars: Either a Dict or the absolute path of JSON or YAML :param extra_vars_file: Set additional ansible variables using an extravar file. :type extra_vars_file: Dictionary :param plan: Plan name (Defaults to "overcloud"). :type plan: String :param gathering_policy: This setting controls the default policy of fact gathering ('smart', 'implicit', 'explicit'). :type gathering_facts: String :param extra_env_variables: Dict option to extend or override any of the default environment variables. :type extra_env_variables: Dict :param parallel_run: Isolate playbook execution when playbooks are to be executed with multi-processing. :type parallel_run: Boolean :param ansible_cfg: Path to an ansible configuration file. One will be generated in the artifact path if this option is None. :type ansible_cfg: String :param ansible_timeout: Timeout for ansible connections. :type ansible_timeout: int :param reproduce_command: Enable or disable option to reproduce ansible commands upon failure. This option will produce a bash script that can reproduce a failing playbook command which is helpful for debugging and retry purposes. :type reproduce_command: Boolean :param fail_on_rc: Enable or disable raising an exception whenever the return code from the playbook execution results in a non 0 exit code. The default is True. :type fail_on_rc: Boolean :param timeout: Timeout for ansible to finish playbook execution (minutes). :type timeout: int """ def _playbook_check(play): if not os.path.exists(play): play = os.path.join(playbook_dir, play) if not os.path.exists(play): raise RuntimeError('No such playbook: {}'.format(play)) LOG.debug('Ansible playbook {} found'.format(play)) return play def _inventory(inventory): if inventory: if isinstance(inventory, six.string_types): # check is file path if os.path.exists(inventory): return inventory elif isinstance(inventory, dict): inventory = yaml.safe_dump( inventory, default_flow_style=False ) return ansible_runner.utils.dump_artifact( inventory, ansible_artifact_path, constants.ANSIBLE_HOSTS_FILENAME ) def _running_ansible_msg(playbook, timeout=None): if timeout and timeout > 0: return ('Running Ansible playbook with timeout %sm: %s,' % (timeout, playbook)) else: return ('Running Ansible playbook: %s,' % playbook) if not playbook_dir: playbook_dir = workdir # Ensure that the ansible-runner env exists runner_env = os.path.join(workdir, 'env') makedirs(runner_env) if extra_vars_file: runner_extra_vars = os.path.join(runner_env, 'extravars') with open(runner_extra_vars, 'w') as f: f.write(yaml.safe_dump(extra_vars_file, default_flow_style=False)) if timeout and timeout > 0: settings_file = os.path.join(runner_env, 'settings') timeout_value = timeout * 60 if os.path.exists(settings_file): with open(settings_file, 'r') as f: settings_object = yaml.safe_load(f.read()) settings_object['job_timeout'] = timeout_value else: settings_object = {'job_timeout': timeout_value} with open(settings_file, 'w') as f: f.write(yaml.safe_dump(settings_object, default_flow_style=False)) if isinstance(playbook, (list, set)): verified_playbooks = [_playbook_check(play=i) for i in playbook] playbook = os.path.join(workdir, 'tripleo-multi-playbook.yaml') with open(playbook, 'w') as f: f.write( yaml.safe_dump( [{'import_playbook': i} for i in verified_playbooks], default_flow_style=False ) ) LOG.info( _running_ansible_msg(playbook, timeout) + ' multi-playbook execution: {}' ' Working directory: {},' ' Playbook directory: {}'.format( verified_playbooks, workdir, playbook_dir ) ) else: playbook = _playbook_check(play=playbook) LOG.info( _running_ansible_msg(playbook, timeout) + ' Working directory: {},' ' Playbook directory: {}'.format( workdir, playbook_dir ) ) if limit_hosts: LOG.info( 'Running ansible with the following limit: subscription tasks accessible to the user are:

commit_message:
Refactor rhel enforcement for overcloud.

We need to enforce a certain policy during update (and deployment as
well) for subscribed OSP.  Problem is that the current ordering force
the user to change its subscription manually before update.

Then, there is no way to change the repos outside without
running the full update.  This can be a source of necessary issues and
would be best, in some environments, to be able to run this on its
own.

This patch addresses those two issues.

For the first part, we move the enforcement call to run after we call
the subscription role.

We also make sure the host_prep_tasks happens before running all the
update tasks.  Now, we run yum upgrade on the right repos.

The new ordering is now :
 - hiera,
 - host prep tasks
 - update tasks
 - deploy step tasks 0
 - deploy step tasks 1
 - deploy step tasks 1-5
 - post update step tasks

Before this change host prep tasks was happening before deploy step
tasks 0.

Note that we still keep an enforcement during update tasks (vs host
prep tasks).  As it may happen that the user is using manual
registration for its overcloud nodes.  Thus the user would not include
the rhsm-baremetal-ansible definition.  When we detect such situation,
ie, RhsmVars is empty, we create the enforcement tasks.  If RhsmVars
is not empty then a debug message is emitted instead.

For the second point, the only necessary changes to make the
subscription tasks accessible to the user are:
 - add the tags "always" to the hiera data tasks;
 - add the tag "rhsm-subscription" to the subscription/enforcement.

This enable the user to use:

    openstack overcloud update run --tags rhsm-subscription

, given that the RhsmVars was updated and loaded into heat (via
openstack update prepare).  Thus the user can run subscription related
command before doing the update.

Then during update the user can use:

   openstack overcloud update run --skip-tags rhsm-subscription --limit Controller

to avoid subscription related tasks.

Change-Id: I933380892a205670baed242a4948316bfd444bf8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/57/733857/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: SkipRhelEnforcement: default: 'false' description: Whether to avoid or not RHEL/OSP policies enforcement on Red Hat. Mainly for CI purpose. It shouldn't matter on other distributions where it's disabled in the role. Set to true to skip the enforcement. type: string - name: Enforce RHOSP rules regarding subscription. include_role: name: tripleo_redhat_enforce vars: skip_rhel_enforcement: {get_param: SkipRhelEnforcement} when: - step|int == 0 - ansible_distribution == 'RedHat' - not (skip_rhel_enforcement | bool)

WIP: persist hostname format in parameter_defaults

Change-Id: Ia33cef9b6e651ea70920cdd8b471af36b2a2d952
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/63/735863/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Update paremeter_defaults self.set_tls_parameters(parameters, env) self.persist_hostname_format(parameters, env) try: plan_utils.update_in_env(swift, env, 'parameter_defaults', parameters) except swiftexceptions.ClientException as err: err_msg = ("Error updating environment for plan %s: %s" % ( self.container, err)) LOG.exception(err_msg) return actions.Result(error=err_msg) def persist_hostname_format(self, parameters, env): # Should never change the hostname format for a role # so set in parameter_defaults if not already set for role in self.role_data: role_name = role.get('name') hostformat_param = role_name + 'HostnameFormat' default_hostformat = role.get('HostnameFormatDefault') explicit_hostformat = env.get('parameter_defaults', {}).get(hostformat_param, None) if explicit_hostformat is None: parameters[hostformat_param] = default_hostformat

commit_message:
Outline directions for undercloud TLS

We're already reorganizing the old SSL guide since much of it needs to
change because the implementation for TLS-everywhere changed. We can
take this opportunity to freshen up and validate the SSL undercloud
guide and make it consistent with the rest of the TLS documentation.

Change-Id: I32c8282869920cd710e148c09e67dfe81f937551
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/79/737879/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Deploying Undercloud TLS ======================== Deploying TLS across the undercloud services is relatively straight-forward and only consists of a few configuration settings. Before you begin, you need to decide if the certificates the undercloud will use are going to be self-signed or issued by an external Certificate Authority (CA). By default, the undercloud will use Certmonger to generate and self-sign certificates. Conversely, you may use an external CA, like FreeIPA, to sign certificates and supply them to the undercloud via configuration. You can also configure FreeIPA as a Certmonger backend, allowing Certmonger to manage certificates issued by FreeIPA. All three techniques are mutually exclusive and depend on your overall TLS strategy. For example, you may wish to use an external CA, like FreeIPA, if you know you're going to deploy *TLS-everywhere* in the overcloud. You can find more information about TLS deployment strategies and components in the :doc:`tls-introduction` documentation. Using Local Self-Signed Certificates ------------------------------------ This option provides a low barrier to entry for deploying TLS in the undercloud, and it's enabled by default as of the Rocky release. This strategy uses Certmonger on the undercloud to generate and sign certificates locally. Certmonger manages the entire certificate lifecycle. You must set the following undercloud.conf options before installing the undercloud:: [DEFAULT] certificate_generation_ca = local generate_service_certificate = True TripleO's default undercloud configuration enables this automatically as of the Rocky release. The ``certificate_generation_ca`` option tells TripleO where to sign certificates. You can configure TripleO to use an external CA or use Certmonger's local CA, which we're doing here. The ``generate_service_certificate`` option instructs TripleO to generate its own TLS certificate during installation. The alternative is to disable ``generate_service_certificate`` and supply the undercloud with a certificate, which we'll describe in the next section. Validation ~~~~~~~~~~ After installation, you should see all undercloud public endpoints configured with HTTPS. You can confirm this using ``openstack endpoint list``. Additionally, you can check the status of the certificate Certmonger generated and signed for the undercloud with ``sudo getcert list``. Using External Certificates with FreeIPA ---------------------------------------- This strategy requires a FreeIPA server to act as the CA. You may have already accounted for this if you're planning on using FreeIPA for *TLS-everywhere*. First, you must enroll the undercloud as a client in FreeIPA. You can do this from any existing FreeIPA client. The FreeIPA server itself is a client. If you don't have access to FreeIPA, you'll need to request these changes. The tripleo-ipa project provides a `playbook <https://opendev.org/x/tripleo-ipa/src/branch/master/tripleo_ipa/playbooks>`_ to assist in creating an undercloud host:: $ kinit $ export IPA_PASSWORD=$IPA_PASSWORD $ export IPA_PRINCIPAL=$IPA_USER $ export UNDERCLOUD_FQDN=undercloud.example.com $ ansible-playbook tripleo_ipa/playbooks/ipa-server-register-undercloud.yaml Next, you need to define an undercloud service. You will need the resulting principal later:: $ ipa service-add --force haproxy/$UNDERCLOUD_FQDN@$REALM Next, you must configure the undercloud to use FreeIPA instead of Certmonger's local CA to sign certificates. This step requires you to set ``certificate_generation_ca`` and the appropriate Kerberos principal using ``service_principal``:: [DEFAULT] certificate_generation_ca = IPA service_principal = haproxy/$UNDERCLOUD_FQDN@$REALM undercloud_public_host = undercloud.ooo.test Using External Certificates --------------------------- This strategy doesn't require FreeIPA and expects you to obtain a valid certificate. To provide your certificate, you must disable ``generate_service_certificate``. If enabled, ``generate_service_certificate`` will take precedence over ``undercloud_service_certificate`` and generate a certificate regardless of the certificate you provided:: [DEFAULT] generate_service_certificate = False undercloud_service_certificate = $PATH

Add a environment file to disable RHOSP enforcement.

This will facilitate disabling the enforcement when it's needed.

Change-Id: Ia694bf57014b074e28d824a8b0e7f5bfec608ec6

commit_message:
Update Octavia certificates in running amphorae

Update certificates and restart octavia-agent in running amphorae when
certificates are being updated on controllers.
It requires having access to the amphora ssh private key from the
undercloud. In case ssh private key cannot be found, performing a
failover of the existing load balancers is needed.

Change-Id: I34e0fe2048365c38dd52a45fcc5f06d17f9bee1f
Related-Bug: #1869203
